Class BallotBox

java.lang.Object
core.BallotBox
public class BallotBox extends Object
Represents an electronic ballot box for securely storing encrypted votes.

This class is responsible for:

  • Accepting and validating vote submissions
  • Preventing duplicate voting through token validation
  • Storing encrypted votes securely
  • Providing encrypted votes for tallying after the voting phase ends
  • Implementing retry logic for transient failures during vote submission

The BallotBox works with the VotingServer to validate voter tokens and with the MixNetwork to anonymize votes before they are tallied.

  • Constructor Details

    • BallotBox

      public BallotBox(VotingServer votingServer, MixNetwork mixNetwork, ElectionManager electionManager)
      Constructs a new BallotBox with the specified dependencies.
      Parameters:
      votingServer - The voting server responsible for token validation
      mixNetwork - The mix network for anonymizing votes
      electionManager - The election manager for phase control

  • Method Details

    • submitVote

      public void submitVote(byte[] encryptedVote, String token, byte[] signature)
      Submits an encrypted vote to the ballot box.

      This method validates the voting token, checks for duplicate token use, and implements retry logic for handling transient errors.

      Parameters:
      encryptedVote - The encrypted vote data
      token - The voting token issued by the voting server
      signature - The voter's signature for non-repudiation
      Throws:
      VoteSubmissionException - If the vote cannot be submitted
      AuthenticationException - If the token is invalid

    • getVoteSignature

      public byte[] getVoteSignature(int index)
      Retrieves the signature for a specific vote.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the vote
      Returns:
      The signature for the specified vote
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the index is out of range

    • getEncryptedVotes

      public List<byte[]> getEncryptedVotes()
      Retrieves all encrypted votes for tallying.

      This method uses the mix network to anonymize votes before returning them. Can only be called after the voting phase has ended.

      Returns:
      A list of anonymized encrypted votes
      Throws:
      SecurityException - If called during the voting phase

    • getVoteCount

      public int getVoteCount()
      Returns the total number of votes collected
      Returns:
      The number of votes
